question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Input Validation Order] CheckCreateProposalInput is called on line 161 but proposalId generation on line 162 happens before validation - can invalid inputs still generate IDs? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Proposal ID Reuse] Line 163 asserts proposal doesn't exist, but what if a proposal was deleted? Can proposal IDs be reused with different content? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Context.Sender Trust] Line 171 uses Context.Sender as Proposer without validation - can the sender be spoofed or manipulated? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Validation Bypass] Two separate Validate calls on lines 161 and 176 - can proposals pass the first but fail the second, causing inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Event Emission Before Storage] ProposalCreated event is fired on line 178 after state update - can reentrancy between these lines cause issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Params Field Security] Line 169 copies input.Params without validation - can malicious serialized data cause execution exploits? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Proposal Field Initialization] Not all ProposalInfo fields are initialized - can uninitialized vote counts cause arithmetic errors? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [OrganizationAddress Validation] input.OrganizationAddress is used without checking if the organization exists - can proposals reference invalid organizations? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [Length Boundary] Line 192 checks Title.Length <= MaxLengthForTitle - what is MaxLengthForTitle and can it be manipulated? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [String Encoding] Length checks don't account for character encoding - can multi-byte characters bypass length limits? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [Null String Handling] No null checks before accessing .Length property - can null strings cause exceptions? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [Description Length] Line 194 checks Description.Length but not content - can malicious scripts or exploits be embedded? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [URL Length] Line 196 checks ProposalDescriptionUrl.Length but ValidateDescriptionUrlScheme also validates the URL - is double validation necessary? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [Constant Values] ReferendumConstants values are not visible in this file - can they be set to extreme values causing DOS? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CheckCreateProposalInput()] [Empty String Check] Length checks allow empty strings (length 0) - should empty titles/descriptions be rejected? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Organization Existence] Line 202 retrieves organization but only checks != null on line 203 - can deleted or invalid organizations pass the null check? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Whitelist Manipulation] Line 204 checks ProposerWhiteList.Contains - can the whitelist be modified between authorization check and proposal creation? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Address Comparison] Uses Address.Contains() for whitelist check - can address comparison be bypassed with equivalent but different address representations? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Multiple Proposers] If ProposerWhiteList contains duplicates, can this create unexpected authorization behavior? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertIsAuthorizedProposer()] [Whitelist Size] No check for whitelist size - can extremely large whitelists cause DOS during Contains() check? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Hash Determinism] Line 210 uses HashHelper.ComputeFrom(createOrganizationInput) - can different inputs produce the same hash, causing organization collisions? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Virtual Address Security] Line 211-212 converts virtual address using CalculateVirtualHash - can this be manipulated to create predictable organization addresses? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [CreationToken Influence] CreationToken affects virtual hash calculation - can attackers manipulate this to create specific organization addresses? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Input Validation] No validation of createOrganizationInput before hash calculation - can malformed inputs cause unexpected hashes? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Referendum/Referendum_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Return Pair Security] Returns both hash and address - can these become inconsistent if one is modified but not the other? (Low)
